meanings.definition: Make plans, especially in a devious way.
meanings.sent1: She schemed to trick her friend into giving her the last cookie.
meanings.sent2: The villain schemed to take over the city by spreading lies.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous cat schemed to steal the fish from the kitchen counter.
meanings.sent4: The cunning fox schemed his way out of the trap set by the hunters.
meanings.sent5: The evil queen schemed to overthrow the king and seize the throne for herself.

meanings.sent1: The architect's schemed for the new building impressed the investors.
meanings.sent2: The detailed schemed for the project ensured everything ran smoothly.
meanings.sent3: The elaborate schemed for the surprise party was almost ruined by a leak.
meanings.sent4: The intricate schemed of the maze puzzled the participants.
meanings.sent5: The strategic schemed of the military operation led to a successful mission.
